security_audit.summary: Legitimate web content fetching utility. Makes network requests to URLs provided by users, parses HTML, and converts to markdown. No filesystem access, no credential access, no persistence mechanisms. Purpose matches capabilities.

content.user_title: Fetch web content as clean markdown
content.value_statement: Converting web pages to markdown is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill uses intelligent content extraction with CSS selectors to fetch any URL and produce clean, readable markdown output for documentation, articles, and reference pages.
actual_capabilities: Fetch any HTTP/HTTPS URL and extract its main content
Use CSS selectors to target specific page elements
Convert HTML to clean, readable markdown automatically
Handle common site patterns like MDN, GitHub docs, and Anthropic docs
Remove navigation, headers, footers, and other noise
Preserve code blocks with proper language highlighting
limitations: May not work with sites requiring authentication
Depends on site structure for content detection

use_cases.title: Fetch technical documentation
use_cases.description: Pull documentation from MDN, Anthropic, or GitHub docs and convert to markdown for offline reading or embedding.

use_cases.title: Extract article content
use_cases.description: Convert blog posts, news articles, and reference pages to clean markdown for summarization and analysis.

use_cases.title: Capture code examples
use_cases.description: Extract code blocks from documentation with proper syntax highlighting for use in projects.

prompt_templates.title: Basic fetch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the web-fetch skill to get the content from {URL} and convert it to markdown.

prompt_templates.title: With selector
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch {URL} and extract only the main article content using the appropriate CSS selector.

prompt_templates.title: Documentation site
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the documentation from {URL} using the platform.claude.com or docs.anthropic.com selector pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Unknown site
prompt_templates.prompt: Fetch {URL} using the Bun script to auto-detect the main content area and convert to clean markdown.

best_practices: Use site-specific selectors when available for cleaner output
Verify the selector matches the intended content before full extraction
Check for authentication requirements on protected sites
anti_patterns: Using generic selectors on sites with complex layouts
Fetching large pages without targeting specific sections

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Run via skill invocation or bun ~/.claude/skills/web-fetch/fetch.ts <url>.

faq.question: What are the rate limits?
faq.answer: No built-in limits. Respect target servers by not making excessive requests in short timeframes.

faq.question: Can I use this with authenticated pages?
faq.answer: The skill makes unauthenticated requests. Sites requiring login or tokens will return error pages.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: The skill only fetches URLs you provide. No data is stored or sent to third-party servers beyond the target URL.

faq.question: Why is the output empty?
faq.answer: The CSS selector may not match any elements. Try broader selectors like main or article, or use the Bun script.

faq.question: How is this different from curl?
faq.answer: curl fetches raw HTML. This skill parses the HTML, extracts main content, removes noise, and outputs clean markdown.
